segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Each device has associated DeviceInformation properties that you can use when you need specific information or when you are building a device selector.
segment.target: Each device has associated DeviceInformation properties that you can use when you need specific information or when you are building a device selector.

segment.source: These properties can be specified an AQS filter to limit the devices that you are enumerating over in order to find the devices with the specified traits.
segment.target: These properties can be specified an AQS filter to limit the devices that you are enumerating over in order to find the devices with the specified traits.

segment.source: You can also use these properties to indicate what information you want returned for each device.
segment.target: You can also use these properties to indicate what information you want returned for each device.

segment.source: That enables you to specify the device information that is returned to your application.
segment.target: That enables you to specify the device information that is returned to your application.

segment.source: For more information about using DeviceInformation properties in your device selector, see Build a device selector.
segment.target: For more information about using DeviceInformation properties in your device selector, see Build a device selector.

segment.source: This topic goes into how to request information properties and also lists some common properties and their purpose.
segment.target: This topic goes into how to request information properties and also lists some common properties and their purpose.

segment.source: A DeviceInformation object is composed of an identity (DeviceInformation.Id), a kind (DeviceInformation.Kind), and a property bag (DeviceInformation.Properties).
segment.target: A DeviceInformation object is composed of an identity (DeviceInformation.Id), a kind (DeviceInformation.Kind), and a property bag (DeviceInformation.Properties).

segment.source: All of the other properties of a DeviceInformation object are derived from the Properties property bag.
segment.target: All of the other properties of a DeviceInformation object are derived from the Properties property bag.

segment.source: For example, Name is derived from System.ItemNameDisplay.
segment.target: For example, Name is derived from System.ItemNameDisplay.

segment.source: This means that the property bag always contains the information necessary to determine the other properties.
segment.target: This means that the property bag always contains the information necessary to determine the other properties.

segment.source: A DeviceInformation object has some basic properties, such as Id and Kind, but most of the properties are stored in a property bag under Properties.
segment.target: A DeviceInformation object has some basic properties, such as Id and Kind, but most of the properties are stored in a property bag under Properties.

segment.source: Because of this, the property bag contains the properties used to source the properties out of the property bag.
segment.target: Because of this, the property bag contains the properties used to source the properties out of the property bag.

segment.source: For example, use System.ItemNameDisplay to source the Name property.
segment.target: For example, use System.ItemNameDisplay to source the Name property.

segment.source: This is a case of a common and well-known property that has a user-friendly name.
segment.target: This is a case of a common and well-known property that has a user-friendly name.

segment.source: Windows provides several of these user-friendly names to make querying for properties easier.
segment.target: Windows provides several of these user-friendly names to make querying for properties easier.

segment.source: When you are requesting properties, you are not limited to the common properties with user-friendly names.
segment.target: When you are requesting properties, you are not limited to the common properties with user-friendly names.

segment.source: You can specify the underlying GUID and property ID (PID) to request any property that is available, even custom properties that are supplied by an individual device or driver.
segment.target: You can specify the underlying GUID and property ID (PID) to request any property that is available, even custom properties that are supplied by an individual device or driver.

segment.source: The format for specifying a custom property is "".
segment.target: The format for specifying a custom property is "".

segment.source: Some properties are common across all DeviceInformationKind objects, but most are unique to a specific kind.
segment.target: Some properties are common across all DeviceInformationKind objects, but most are unique to a specific kind.

segment.source: The following sections list some common properties sorted by the individual DeviceInformationKind.
segment.target: The following sections list some common properties sorted by the individual DeviceInformationKind.

segment.source: For more information about how the different kinds relate to one another, see DeviceInformationKind.
segment.target: For more information about how the different kinds relate to one another, see DeviceInformationKind.

segment.source: DeviceInterface is the default and most common DeviceInformationKind object used in app scenarios.
segment.target: DeviceInterface is the default and most common DeviceInformationKind object used in app scenarios.

segment.source: This is the kind of object that you should use unless the device API indicates a different specific DeviceInformationKind.
segment.target: This is the kind of object that you should use unless the device API indicates a different specific DeviceInformationKind.

segment.source: Identity of the DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer that contains the Device containing this DeviceInterface.
segment.target: Identity of the DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer that contains the Device containing this DeviceInterface.

segment.source: You can pass this value to CreateFromIdAsync along with DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer to find the appropriate container.
segment.target: You can pass this value to CreateFromIdAsync along with DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer to find the appropriate container.

segment.source: The interface class GUID this interface represents.
segment.target: The interface class GUID this interface represents.

segment.source: You can pass this value to CreateFromIdAsync along with DeviceInformationKind.Device to find the appropriate device.
segment.target: You can pass this value to CreateFromIdAsync along with DeviceInformationKind.Device to find the appropriate device.

segment.source: Indicates if the interface is enabled.
segment.target: Indicates if the interface is enabled.

segment.source: DeviceInformation.IsEnabled is derived from this property.
segment.target: DeviceInformation.IsEnabled is derived from this property.

segment.source: Indicates whether this is the default device for the System.Devices.InterfaceClassGuid.
segment.target: Indicates whether this is the default device for the System.Devices.InterfaceClassGuid.

segment.source: This is mainly used for printers.
segment.target: This is mainly used for printers.

segment.source: This does not work for audio since there are multiple audio defaults.
segment.target: This does not work for audio since there are multiple audio defaults.

segment.source: Use GetDefaultAudioRenderId or GetDefaultAudioCaptureId to get audio defaults.
segment.target: Use GetDefaultAudioRenderId or GetDefaultAudioCaptureId to get audio defaults.

segment.source: The best display name for the device object.
segment.target: The best display name for the device object.

segment.source: Device class used during device installation.
segment.target: Device class used during device installation.

segment.source: For more information, see Device Setup Classes.
segment.target: For more information, see Device Setup Classes.

segment.source: The compatible ids of the device.
segment.target: The compatible ids of the device.

segment.source: These are used when Windows is determining the best driver to install on the device.
segment.target: These are used when Windows is determining the best driver to install on the device.

segment.source: For more information, see Compatible ID.
segment.target: For more information, see Compatible ID.

segment.source: Identity of the DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer that includes this device.
segment.target: Identity of the DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer that includes this device.

segment.source: You can pass this value to CreateFromIdAsync along with DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer to find the appropriate container.
segment.target: You can pass this value to CreateFromIdAsync along with DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer to find the appropriate container.

segment.source: A bitwise-OR of the CM\_DEVCAP\_X capabilities flags that are defined in CfgMgr32.h.
segment.target: A bitwise-OR of the CM\_DEVCAP\_X capabilities flags that are defined in CfgMgr32.h.

segment.source: The device currently has a problem and is likely not functioning correctly.
segment.target: The device currently has a problem and is likely not functioning correctly.

segment.source: This could be due to an outdated, missing, or invalid driver.
segment.target: This could be due to an outdated, missing, or invalid driver.

segment.source: This is also the value of DeviceInformation.Id.
segment.target: This is also the value of DeviceInformation.Id.

segment.source: The hardware ids of the device.
segment.target: The hardware ids of the device.

segment.source: Windows uses these ids when determining the best driver to install.
segment.target: Windows uses these ids when determining the best driver to install.

segment.source: Device vendors can use this property to identify their device from their app.
segment.target: Device vendors can use this property to identify their device from their app.

segment.source: For more information, see Hardware ID.
segment.target: For more information, see Hardware ID.

segment.source: The DeviceInformation.Id of the parent device.
segment.target: The DeviceInformation.Id of the parent device.

segment.source: This is the connection parent, not the DeviceContainer parent.
segment.target: This is the connection parent, not the DeviceContainer parent.

segment.source: Indicates whether the device is currently present and available.
segment.target: Indicates whether the device is currently present and available.

segment.source: The best display name for this device object.
segment.target: The best display name for this device object.

segment.source: In this case, this is not necessarily the best name for users.
segment.target: In this case, this is not necessarily the best name for users.

segment.source: A more likely candidate for a user-friendly name could be found by referencing the System.ItemNameDisplay of the associated DeviceContainer or DeviceInterface.
segment.target: A more likely candidate for a user-friendly name could be found by referencing the System.ItemNameDisplay of the associated DeviceContainer or DeviceInterface.

segment.source: A list of descriptions of the categories the device belongs to.
segment.target: A list of descriptions of the categories the device belongs to.

segment.source: This list is provided as singular categories.
segment.target: This list is provided as singular categories.

segment.source: Contains a list of categories this device belongs to.
segment.target: Contains a list of categories this device belongs to.

segment.source: For example, Audio.Headphone, Display.Monitor, or Input.Gaming.
segment.target: For example, Audio.Headphone, Display.Monitor, or Input.Gaming.

segment.source: A list of descriptions of the categories the device belongs to.
segment.target: A list of descriptions of the categories the device belongs to.

segment.source: This list is provided as plural categories.
segment.target: This list is provided as plural categories.

segment.source: The collection of compatible ids for all the child DeviceInformationKind.Device objects.
segment.target: The collection of compatible ids for all the child DeviceInformationKind.Device objects.

segment.source: Indicates whether the device is currently connected to the system or not.
segment.target: Indicates whether the device is currently connected to the system or not.

segment.source: The collection of hardware ids for all the child DeviceInformationKind.Device objects.
segment.target: The collection of hardware ids for all the child DeviceInformationKind.Device objects.

segment.source: True if this DeviceContainer represents the system itself, false if the device is external to the system.
segment.target: True if this DeviceContainer represents the system itself, false if the device is external to the system.

segment.source: Model name of the device container.
segment.target: Model name of the device container.

segment.source: Indicates whether any of the child DeviceInformationKind.Device objects are wireless or network devices that are currently paired with the system.
segment.target: Indicates whether any of the child DeviceInformationKind.Device objects are wireless or network devices that are currently paired with the system.

segment.source: The best display name for this device.
segment.target: The best display name for this device.

segment.source: The best display name for this device.
segment.target: The best display name for this device.

segment.source: This is also the value of DeviceInformation.Id.
segment.target: This is also the value of DeviceInformation.Id.

segment.source: Indicates if the device can be paired with the system or not.
segment.target: Indicates if the device can be paired with the system or not.

segment.source: DeviceInformationPairing.CanPair is derived from this property.
segment.target: DeviceInformationPairing.CanPair is derived from this property.

segment.source: The categories that the device is part of.
segment.target: The categories that the device is part of.

segment.source: The id of the parent AssociationEndpointContainer object.
segment.target: The id of the parent AssociationEndpointContainer object.

segment.source: If the device is a network device, this is the IP address.
segment.target: If the device is a network device, this is the IP address.

segment.source: Indicates if the device is currently connected to the system.
segment.target: Indicates if the device is currently connected to the system.

segment.source: Indicates if the device is currently paired.
segment.target: Indicates if the device is currently paired.

segment.source: DeviceInformationPairing.IsPaired is derived from this property.
segment.target: DeviceInformationPairing.IsPaired is derived from this property.

segment.source: Indicates if the device is currently present, meaning the device is live and discovered over the network or wireless protocol.
segment.target: Indicates if the device is currently present, meaning the device is live and discovered over the network or wireless protocol.

segment.source: Once a device has been paired with the system, the device is cached.
segment.target: Once a device has been paired with the system, the device is cached.

segment.source: After this, the device will be automatically discovered when querying for AssociationEndpoint objects.
segment.target: After this, the device will be automatically discovered when querying for AssociationEndpoint objects.

segment.source: Because of this, you cannot rely on just discovering the device with a query to indicate whether or not it is currently usable.
segment.target: Because of this, you cannot rely on just discovering the device with a query to indicate whether or not it is currently usable.

segment.source: That is why this property is important.
segment.target: That is why this property is important.

segment.source: The model id of the device.
segment.target: The model id of the device.

segment.source: The model name of the device.
segment.target: The model name of the device.

segment.source: Indicates the protocol used to discover this AssocationEndpoint device.
segment.target: Indicates the protocol used to discover this AssocationEndpoint device.

segment.source: The signal strength of the device.
segment.target: The signal strength of the device.

segment.source: This property is only applicable for some protocols.
segment.target: This property is only applicable for some protocols.

segment.source: The best display name for the device.
segment.target: The best display name for the device.

segment.source: The categories that the device is part of.
segment.target: The categories that the device is part of.

segment.source: The collection of ids for the AssocationEndpoint objects that are part of this container.
segment.target: The collection of ids for the AssocationEndpoint objects that are part of this container.

segment.source: Indicates if one of the child AssociationEndpoint devices can be paired with the system or not.
segment.target: Indicates if one of the child AssociationEndpoint devices can be paired with the system or not.

segment.source: DeviceInformationPairing.CanPair is derived from this property.
segment.target: DeviceInformationPairing.CanPair is derived from this property.

segment.source: This is also the value of DeviceInformation.Id, but in GUID form.
segment.target: This is also the value of DeviceInformation.Id, but in GUID form.

segment.source: Indicates if one of the child AssociationEndpoint devices is currently paired.
segment.target: Indicates if one of the child AssociationEndpoint devices is currently paired.

segment.source: DeviceInformationPairing.IsPaired is derived from this property.
segment.target: DeviceInformationPairing.IsPaired is derived from this property.

segment.source: Indicates if one of the child AssociationEndpoint devices is currently present, meaning the device is live and discovered over the network or wireless protocol.
segment.target: Indicates if one of the child AssociationEndpoint devices is currently present, meaning the device is live and discovered over the network or wireless protocol.

segment.source: Once a device has been paired with the system, the device is cached.
segment.target: Once a device has been paired with the system, the device is cached.

segment.source: After this, the device will be automatically discovered when querying for AssociationEndpoint objects.
segment.target: After this, the device will be automatically discovered when querying for AssociationEndpoint objects.

segment.source: Because of this, you cannot rely on just discovering the device with a query to indicate whether or not it is currently usable.
segment.target: Because of this, you cannot rely on just discovering the device with a query to indicate whether or not it is currently usable.

segment.source: That is why this property is important.
segment.target: That is why this property is important.

segment.source: A list of model ids for the device.
segment.target: A list of model ids for the device.

segment.source: Each model is a GUID in string form.
segment.target: Each model is a GUID in string form.

segment.source: The model name of the device.
segment.target: The model name of the device.

segment.source: A list of protocol ids that have contributed to building this AssociationEndpointContainer object.
segment.target: A list of protocol ids that have contributed to building this AssociationEndpointContainer object.

segment.source: Keep in mind that an AssociationEndpointContainer device is created by collecting all AssociationEndpoint devices discovered over different protocols for the same physical device.
segment.target: Keep in mind that an AssociationEndpointContainer device is created by collecting all AssociationEndpoint devices discovered over different protocols for the same physical device.

segment.source: List of casting URI schemes supported by this device.
segment.target: List of casting URI schemes supported by this device.

segment.source: Indicates if this device supports audio casting.
segment.target: Indicates if this device supports audio casting.

segment.source: Indicates if this device supports image casting.
segment.target: Indicates if this device supports image casting.

segment.source: Indicates if this device supports video casting.
segment.target: Indicates if this device supports video casting.

segment.source: The best display name for the device.
segment.target: The best display name for the device.

segment.source: The identifier of the parent AssociationEndpoint object.
segment.target: The identifier of the parent AssociationEndpoint object.

segment.source: The identifier of the parent AssociationEndpointContainer object.
segment.target: The identifier of the parent AssociationEndpointContainer object.

segment.source: Indicates whether the parent AssociationEndpoint object is paired with the system.
segment.target: Indicates whether the parent AssociationEndpoint object is paired with the system.

segment.source: Identity of the protocol used to discover this device.
segment.target: Identity of the protocol used to discover this device.

segment.source: Iidentity of the service represented by this device.
segment.target: Iidentity of the service represented by this device.

segment.source: This is also the value of DeviceInformation.Id.
segment.target: This is also the value of DeviceInformation.Id.

segment.source: The best display name for the service.
segment.target: The best display name for the service.
